client.controller

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • client.controller.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    The Controller class is responsible for handling input commands passed from client.view.Interpreter. Then it calls client.net.ServerConnection to send the processed texts to the seerver. It compares input with types of valid commands which are available in client.controller.CmdType. If its not matched, an error message will be shown. for the commands that needs communication with the server we use common.MsgType We have client.view.SafeOutput reference for printing error and exceptions. defiend message types.
    See Also:
    ServerConnection, CmdType, MsgType, SafeOutput

      The constructor saves client.view.SafeOutput reference.

    • Method Detail

      • handleCMD

        public void handleCMD(java.lang.String cmd)
        Splites the input string and compares first part with client.controller.CmdType types. and communicates with the client.net.ServerConnection by common.MsgType.
        Parameters:
        cmd - It is incomming command
        See Also:
        ServerConnection, MsgType
